# Government Tender Announcement

## Request for Standing Offer: Standard First Aid and Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR)/Automated External Defibrillator (AED) Training

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) has a requirement for the provision of Standard First Aid and Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR)/Automated External Defibrillator (AED) training to its employees.

### Objectives

* Provide CSC employees with training and certification in first aid as First Aid & CPR attendants, First Aid & CPR Instructors, and CPR/AED at Health Care Provider (HCP)-level Instructors
* Ensure training content meets the 2016 National Guidelines for First Aid training and is recognized by the Worker Safety & Insurance Board (WSIB) Ontario
* Provide CSC certified employee trainers with the necessary tools to deliver training to other CSC employees

### Deliverables

* Trainer certification and certification for CSC employees in First Aid and CPR/AED (up to 600 employees yearly) and CPR/AED at HCP-level training (up to 100 employees yearly)
* All necessary materials and equipment for delivering First Aid & CPR, CPR/AED at HCP-level training, including training manuals, written and practical exercises, and handouts
* Testing and evaluation as required for trainer certification
* Course materials in both official languages (English and French)
* Delivery of course materials and equipment to training locations prior to course start
* Certification of successful participants and hard copies of certificates within 21 days of course completion
